meanings.definition: Separate or be separated into parts
meanings.sent1: The river divides the forest into two sections.
meanings.sent2: The knife easily divides the cake into slices.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to make the scarf divides into two pieces.
meanings.sent4: The invisible line divides the playground into two territories.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake divides the road, making it impassable.

meanings.sent1: She divides the puzzle pieces to make it easier to solve.
meanings.sent2: The teacher divides the class into groups for a project.
meanings.sent3: The wind divides the sand into small dunes.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully divides the dough into equal portions.
meanings.sent5: The explosion divides the rock into fragments.

meanings.definition: Act as a barrier between two things
meanings.sent1: The wall divides the garden from the street.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range divides the two countries.
meanings.sent3: The thick fog divides the field from view.
meanings.sent4: The language barrier divides them from understanding each other.
meanings.sent5: The fence divides the backyard from the front yard.

meanings.definition: Disagree or cause disagreement between people or groups
meanings.sent1: Their conflicting opinions on the matter divides the team.
meanings.sent2: The controversial topic divides the community.
meanings.sent3: The silly argument divides the friends for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The political issue divides the nation into opposing sides.
meanings.sent5: The misunderstanding divides the family temporarily.
